member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.AccountId
member.summary: The ID of the AWS account that owns the rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.ConfigRuleArn
member.summary: The ARN that AWS Config assigned to the rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.ConfigRuleId
member.summary: The ID that AWS Config assigned to the rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.ConfigRuleName
member.summary: The name that you assigned to the rule that caused AWS Config to publish the event and invoke the function.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.EventLeftScope
member.summary: A Boolean value that indicates whether the AWS resource to be evaluated has been removed from the rule's scope.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.ExecutionRoleArn
member.summary: The ARN of the IAM role that is assigned to AWS Config.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.InvokingEvent
member.summary: If the event is published in response to a resource configuration change, the value for this attribute is a string that contains a JSON configuration item.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.ResultToken
member.summary: A token that the function must pass to AWS Config with the PutEvaluations call.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.RuleParameters
member.summary: Key/value pairs that the function processes as part of its evaluation logic.

member.name: P:Amazon.Lambda.ConfigEvents.ConfigEvent.Version
member.summary: A version number assigned by AWS. The version will increment if AWS adds attributes to AWS Config events. If a function requires an attribute that is only in events that match or exceed a specific version, then that function can check the value of this attribute.
